title: Kamala Harris to Rally in Hurricane-Hit North Carolina
news:
Democratic vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris will return to North Carolina this weekend, holding a campaign event in the state still recovering from Hurricane Helene. Harris, who visited the state last week to survey the damage and pledge federal assistance, will participate in a "Souls to the Polls" effort on Sunday and hold a rally focused on the economy on Monday.  

The trip marks Harris's second visit to North Carolina since the hurricane hit, highlighting the state's importance in the upcoming election. Democrats view North Carolina as a potential swing state, with its diverse population and strong support for Democratic candidates. However, the hurricane's aftermath has become a political flashpoint, with former President Donald Trump and his allies attacking the Biden administration's response. 

Harris's events will be focused on both recovery efforts and campaign issues. On Saturday, she will meet with African American leaders in Raleigh and work with volunteers preparing relief supplies for hurricane victims. Her Sunday church visit in Greenville is part of a "Souls to the Polls" initiative aimed at increasing voter turnout among African American communities. 

The campaign rally on Monday will focus on the economy, a key issue for voters in the upcoming election. The event comes as early voting begins in North Carolina on Thursday. 

Harris has also been vocal about combating price gouging, which has become an issue in the wake of the hurricanes. She has vowed to hold companies accountable for any attempts to take advantage of shortages caused by the natural disasters.

title: Pakistan Imposes Restrictions Ahead of SCO Summit Amidst PTI Protests
news:
Karachi and five districts in Punjab, Pakistan, have implemented Section 144 restrictions ahead of the two-day Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit scheduled for October 15-16. The restrictions, which prohibit public gatherings of five or more people, processions, and meetings, are in place to maintain law and order and ensure public safety. 

The decision to impose these restrictions follows a recommendation from Sindh Inspector General of Police Ghulam Nabi Memon, citing potential threats to peace from planned protests. 

The timing of the restrictions coincides with a planned protest by the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party at Islamabad’s D-Chowk on October 15, potentially disrupting the SCO Summit where several international leaders are expected to be present. 

Authorities are taking precautions to minimize the risk of disruption and maintain security during this high-profile event.

title: NCST Blames "Bangladeshi Infiltration" for Santhal Pargana Issues, Calls for NGO Involvement
news:
The National Commission for Scheduled Tribes (NCST) has released a report on demographic changes in Jharkhand's Santhal Pargana region, attributing a range of problems to "Bangladeshi infiltration." The report, which was submitted to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, recommends engaging NGOs to address this alleged issue.

The NCST report claims that demographic changes over the past seven decades have been fueled by illegal immigration from Bangladesh. This directly contradicts the Union government's position, as expressed in a recent Home Ministry affidavit before the Jharkhand High Court. The report, however, acknowledges the difficulty in accurately enumerating the number of "Bangladeshi infiltrators" due to fluctuating figures and limitations in official records.

The report further links several issues raised by local Adivasis to "illegal immigration," including lack of government scheme penetration, land disputes, human trafficking, missing girls, and cybercrime. It also alleges that sacred Adivasi land is being converted into Muslim cemeteries and cites instances of "Bangladeshi Muslims" acting as middlemen to prevent Adivasis from accessing government benefits.

The report's claims have been met with criticism.  Jharkhand has no international border, and Pakur district, which the report alleges shares a border with Bangladesh, actually borders West Bengal. Furthermore, the 2021 Census has been indefinitely postponed. 

The report relies heavily on anecdotal evidence gathered from conversations with locals, with details such as the time and location of alleged incidents often missing. Some claims, like the alleged forced marriages of Adivasi women to "Bangladeshi Muslims," have been previously refuted by the women involved. 

The NCST's report has fueled the ongoing debate on demographic changes in Santhal Pargana, which has become a focal point in the upcoming Jharkhand Assembly elections. While the Opposition BJP cites "illegal immigration" as the root cause, the ruling Jharkhand Mukti Morcha places the onus on the Centre to curb such immigration.

title: New Zealand Women Secure Semifinal Hopes with Dominant Win over Sri Lanka
news:
New Zealand's women's cricket team strengthened their chances of qualifying for the semifinals of the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup 2024 with a resounding eight-wicket victory over Sri Lanka on Saturday.  The key to the win was a stellar performance from Georgia Plimmer, who scored 53 runs off 44 balls, and Amelia Kerr, who starred with both bat and ball. 

Kerr was instrumental in stifling Sri Lanka's batting, claiming 2 wickets for 13 runs, while also contributing an unbeaten 34 runs in the chase. This all-round performance ensured New Zealand reached their target of 116 in the 18th over. 

This crucial victory keeps New Zealand in contention for a semifinal spot as they head into their final Group A match against Pakistan on Monday.  Sri Lanka, on the other hand, are eliminated from the tournament without a single win.

title: India Dominates Bangladesh in Third T20I, Winning 3-0 Series
news:
India secured a dominant 3-0 series victory against Bangladesh in the third T20I, winning by a massive 133 runs at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Captain Suryakumar Yadav praised his team's batting flexibility and performance, highlighting the importance of adaptability and selflessness within the squad. 

India's innings saw a breathtaking 111 runs from Sanju Samson off just 47 balls, along with a solid 75 from Suryakumar himself. This helped India set a record-breaking total of 297/6, the second highest score in men's T20I history against Bangladesh.

Suryakumar stressed the importance of adaptability for both batters and bowlers. He emphasized the importance of supporting each other, regardless of individual scores,  and staying focused on maintaining good habits on the field.

While Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto acknowledged his team's shortcomings, he emphasized the need for improvement and accountability. He pointed to Hridoy's batting performance as a positive, but stressed the need for improvement from the top order.

This victory extends India's unbeaten streak in T20I series at home to 16 matches.

title: Sanju Samson's Century Anchors India to 3-0 T20I Series Sweep Over Bangladesh
news:
India's wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson played a pivotal role in India's dominant 133-run win over Bangladesh in the third T20I, completing a 3-0 series sweep. 

Samson smashed an incredible 111 runs off just 47 balls, including 11 fours and 8 sixes, becoming the first Indian wicketkeeper-batter to achieve a century in men's T20Is. He attributed his success to focusing on the basics and taking each ball at a time.  

Samson's performance came after a challenging period where he struggled in the first two matches of the series. He highlighted the importance of staying focused on the process and learning from past failures. He expressed gratitude for the team's support and emphasized the importance of enjoying the game to perform at one's best.  

His innings also made him the second-fastest Indian batsman to score a century in T20Is, behind Rohit Sharma.

title: India Breaks Records in T20I Domination Over Bangladesh
news:
India's T20I team smashed records in the third and final match against Bangladesh, securing a dominant 3-0 series sweep. The highlight was Sanju Samson's blistering maiden T20I century, achieved in just 40 balls, making it the second fastest century by an Indian in the format. 

This performance was a crucial factor in India's record-breaking total of 297/6, which is now the highest score by a full-member nation in T20I history, eclipsing their previous record of 260/5.  

Samson's explosive innings included eight towering sixes and 11 boundaries. He shared a monumental 173-run partnership with captain Suryakumar Yadav, who himself contributed a blistering 75 off 35 balls. 

The duo's onslaught resulted in several other record-breaking feats:

* **Joint-highest Powerplay score:**  India's 82/1 in the first six overs matches their highest powerplay score achieved against Scotland in 2021.
* **Fastest 100, 150, and 200:**  India reached the 100-run mark in just 7.1 overs, the 150-run mark in 9.5 overs, and the 200-run mark in 14 overs, all the fastest in this format.

With this victory, India cemented their dominance over Bangladesh and demonstrated their formidable batting prowess in the T20I format.

title: OMR 360° Concludes with a Vision for Future Development
news:
The Federation of OMR Residents Associations (FOMRRA) concluded its OMR 360° event on a high note, celebrating a shared vision for future development in the region.  The five-month event, held at Marina Mall, saw over 500 prizes awarded to winners of various competitions, with House of Hiranandani taking home the "Overall Championship" title.

FOMRRA co-founder Harsha Koda emphasized the event's success in fostering a sense of community amongst the 200 participating associations. OMR 360° included a diverse range of activities, from apartment-based competitions to mixed-gender cricket and a Quadrathlon. The event also highlighted the importance of healthy lifestyles, with Dr. Kamakshi Memorial Hospital, the event's title sponsor, providing essential medical services.

The event showcased the talent and enthusiasm of residents, particularly children, with professionals guiding and judging participants. Koda announced plans for a coffee table book featuring over 200 articles from The Hindu, set to be released next October to commemorate FOMRRA's anniversary. The "Impact" initiative, aimed at encouraging collective civic action, was also launched.

Local officials lauded the initiative. Tiruporur MLA S.S. Balaji highlighted the importance of continued civic engagement in promoting community cohesion. Sholinganallur MLA S. Aravind Ramesh announced new water connections for high-rise buildings and shared updates on ongoing sewage and stormwater drain projects.

Resident Anitha Nagarajan, a participant in 11 events and winner of four medals, praised the event for providing opportunities to connect with fellow residents and pursue her passions.  Sasi Vedachalam echoed her sentiments, noting the boost in confidence she experienced through participating in the Quadrathlon.

Koda concluded by emphasizing the event's role in fostering a stronger community, enabling informed decision-making, and strengthening the voice of residents to ensure elected officials address their needs. He acknowledged the crucial contributions of various sponsors and partners, highlighting their dedication to the event's success.

title: Maharashtra Election Heats Up as Shiv Sena Splits
news:
The upcoming Maharashtra Assembly elections have taken a dramatic turn as the Shiv Sena, once a united force, now faces off in a bitter battle between the factions led by Uddhav Thackeray and Eknath Shinde. Both leaders used the recent Dasara rallies to solidify their positions, each targeting the other with sharp criticisms. 

Uddhav Thackeray, former Chief Minister and head of the Shiv Sena (UBT), declared himself as the CM candidate for the upcoming elections. He vowed to prevent "Modi, Shah, and Adani" from taking control of Maharashtra, claiming that the current BJP-led government was focused on power rather than the well-being of the state.  He also appealed to the RSS to introspect on its support of the BJP, accusing the party of trying to "finish off" his faction of the Shiv Sena. 

Meanwhile, Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, leader of the other Shiv Sena faction, launched a scathing attack on Thackeray, questioning his ability to lead and highlighting his perceived failures during his tenure. He pointed to the "speedbreakers" put on development projects during Thackeray's leadership and touted his own government's achievements, including financial assistance for farmers and job training programs.  

Both sides took aim at the Dharavi redevelopment project, with Thackeray vowing to cancel it if elected and Shinde accusing Thackeray of opposing the project while supporting lavish bungalows. 

This escalation of conflict sets the stage for a highly polarized election campaign in Maharashtra, where the battle lines are drawn not only between political parties but also within a party that once held significant sway in the state.

title: Over 30 Sites Designated for Durga Idol Immersion in Delhi
news:
The Delhi government has prepared over 30 locations for the immersion of Durga idols on Sunday, prioritizing safety and environmental regulations. The move comes after the government banned idol immersion in rivers, including the Sahibi river, a Yamuna tributary. 

To facilitate the practice, the administration has set up artificial ponds at various locations. The Irrigation and Flood Control Department is responsible for ensuring the timely completion of these ponds. The Sub-Divisional Magistrates (SDMs) and DDA officials will inspect all designated sites. Any violation of the guidelines will result in a fine of ₹50,000, enforced by the Delhi Pollution Control Committee.

title: Omar Abdullah: A Return to Power in a Changed Jammu and Kashmir
news:
Omar Abdullah, son of former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah, is set to become the first Chief Minister of the region after the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019. His National Conference party won a decisive victory in the recent assembly elections, surprising both allies and opponents. 

Abdullah's second term comes at a pivotal moment for Jammu and Kashmir. The state was split into two Union Territories in 2019, and its special constitutional status revoked. This has significantly altered the political landscape, with New Delhi having greater control over the region's governance. 

Abdullah faces the challenge of balancing the expectations of the people with the limits imposed by the central government. He must navigate a delicate path, seeking a "healthy working relationship" with the Centre while addressing key issues such as governance and the restoration of eroded institutions.

Despite his political experience, including a previous term as Chief Minister, Abdullah faces a weakened position due to the diluted executive powers. His campaign promises, including the restoration of Article 370 and the release of political prisoners, may prove difficult to fulfill, especially given the ongoing antagonism between the National Conference and the central government. 

The road ahead will be challenging, but Abdullah’s return to power represents a significant moment for Jammu and Kashmir, offering a potential shift in the region's political dynamics.

title: AAP Accuses DDA of Scam in Housing Scheme, DDA Calls it Defamation Attempt
news:
The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has accused the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) of running a scam in its Kalkaji slum rehabilitation project. Urban Development Minister Saurabh Bharadwaj alleges that flats meant for the poor are being given to ineligible individuals. He further accuses Lieutenant-Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena, the DDA Chairperson, of ignoring the corruption involving "top DDA officials."

The DDA, however, vehemently denies these claims, stating that it has a foolproof system to prevent fraudulent allotments. The agency asserts that its investigation reveals the allegations are politically motivated, with individuals "associated with a political party" working at the "behest of a leader" to defame the DDA and its popular slum rehabilitation scheme. 

The DDA has threatened to pursue the matter with the police and resort to judicial remedies if necessary. 

The Delhi BJP, meanwhile, has accused AAP of spreading misinformation and questioned why the AAP government had failed to allocate 40,000 flats built under the Rajiv Awas Yojana during the previous Congress government's tenure. 

The accusations come amidst the ongoing political battle between the AAP and the BJP in Delhi.

title: Tamil Nadu Train Collision: High-Level Inquiry Ordered, Sabotage Suspected
news:
A high-level inquiry has been ordered by the Indian Railways following a collision between the Mysuru-Darbhanga Express and a stationary goods train near Chennai on the night of October 11, 2024. While there were no fatalities, at least nine people were injured, eleven coaches of the express train derailed, and a parcel van caught fire.

The incident occurred at Kavaraipettai, a suburb of Chennai. The speeding express train, despite receiving a green signal to proceed on the main line, collided with the rear of the goods train on a loop line.  

The National Investigation Agency (NIA) is investigating the possibility of sabotage, while the Commissioner of Railway Safety has conducted an inspection of the site. 

The Southern Railway General Manager attributed the collision to an unusual entry of the express train into the loop line, despite signals indicating the main line. However, he did not comment on whether signal failure was the cause.

The incident caused disruption to train services, with at least 45 trains diverted or rescheduled. Restoration work was completed by Saturday night. Passengers on the express train, most of whom were from Bihar and Andhra Pradesh, were provided food, water, temporary accommodation, and transportation to their destinations.

title: Speedy Restoration Clears Track After Train Accident in Tamil Nadu
news:
A train accident in Tamil Nadu, involving the Mysore–Darbhanga Bagmati Express and a goods train near Kavaraipettai, resulted in a swift rescue and restoration operation. The Southern Railway, coordinating with multiple agencies, worked with urgency and precision to clear the track and ensure safety.

Key agencies, including the NDRF, Tamil Nadu Fire and Rescue Services, State Police, Railway Protection Force, and Government Railway Police, were mobilized. Over 500 personnel worked on the ground, deploying heavy machinery like earth-movers, cranes, and specialized re-railing equipment. 

By the evening, the mainline was cleared of derailed coaches and services were partially restored.  The Southern Railway also cancelled previously announced diversions for trains on the affected line.

While the exact cause of the accident is under investigation, officials suspect a signal failure due to loosened bolts in the points and blocks system.  The Commissioner of Railway Safety is conducting a statutory inspection.

Despite the incident, Union Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting L. Murugan emphasized that train accidents have significantly decreased in the last decade, calling this incident a "rare occurrence."

title: Ratan Tata's Inspiring Words: An IAS Officer Recalls His Encounter
news:
IAS officer Rohan Chand Thakur, currently the Managing Director of the Himachal Pradesh Road Transport Corporation, shared a poignant memory of his meeting with the late industrialist Ratan Tata.

Thakur, who started his career at the Tata Group in 2006, recounted his first encounter with the business icon during a training session in Mumbai. Despite being surrounded by other young professionals, Thakur was fortunate enough to sit next to Ratan Tata.

Thakur remembers three things from this meeting: Ratan Tata's modest demeanor despite his success, his insightful answer to a question about the challenges of leading the Tata Group in 1991, and the inspiring words that the industrialist shared with the group of aspiring professionals.

When asked about the challenges of his leadership during a difficult time, Ratan Tata acknowledged the struggles and highlighted the role of young people in giving him hope. He emphasized their desire for change and their belief in a better future.

Thakur says this encounter, lasting only 30 minutes, has stayed with him for nearly two decades, serving as a source of inspiration throughout his career.

title: Two Arrested for Kidnapping in Chennai
news:
Two men from Andhra Pradesh have been arrested by Chennai's Vadapalani police for allegedly kidnapping a 20-year-old man. 

The victim, K. Dinesh, was working at a private firm in Vadapalani and residing there. He was kidnapped on Thursday morning while walking with a colleague, Baskar, on Duraiswamy Street.  

Police identified the suspects as 21-year-old Surendra Reddy from Tirupati and 20-year-old Venkata Jeya Manikanda from Cuddapah.  The motive for the kidnapping was a monetary dispute, with Reddy claiming Dinesh had borrowed money and failed to repay it. 

The police were alerted by Baskar, Dinesh's colleague, and were able to locate and arrest the suspects.

title: Nobel Peace Prize Winners Warn of Rising Nuclear War Risk
news:
The 2024 Nobel Peace Prize recipients, a group of Japanese atomic bomb survivors known as Nihon Hidankyo, have issued a stark warning about the escalating risk of nuclear war.  The group, recognized for their decades-long efforts to abolish nuclear weapons, highlighted the increasing global tensions and the threat of nuclear use by various nations.

Shigemitsu Tanaka, a survivor of the 1945 bombing of Nagasaki and co-head of Nihon Hidankyo, expressed deep concern, stating that “the international situation is getting progressively worse, and now wars are being waged as countries threaten the use of nuclear weapons." He further warned, “I fear that we as humankind are on the path to self-destruction. The only way to stop that is to abolish nuclear.” 

The Norwegian Nobel Committee, in awarding the prize, acknowledged the devastating impact of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki and highlighted the crucial importance of Nihon Hidankyo's anti-nuclear efforts in today's world. The committee did not specifically name any countries in their statement.

Russia's recent threats to use nuclear weapons if the US and its allies support Ukrainian strikes deep inside Russia fueled concerns about the possibility of nuclear escalation. This, alongside ongoing global conflicts, underscores the urgency of the Nobel laureates' message and their call for a world free from nuclear weapons.

title: Another Official Arrested in Puducherry Temple Land Scam
news:
A senior official, G. Johnson, former Deputy Collector of Revenue in Karaikal, Puducherry, has been arrested for his alleged involvement in a temple land grabbing scheme. Johnson was apprehended by the Special Investigation Team (SIT) of the Karaikal Police on October 10th. 

The SIT is investigating the illegal acquisition of land belonging to Sri Parvatheeswarar Swamy Devasthanam temple. Johnson is accused of forging documents to create fake land titles (patta) for the temple land, with the intention of selling it to private individuals.

Johnson's arrest comes after the SIT already detained other individuals in connection with the case, including Sachi alias Renuga, Deputy Surveyor of Karaikal Municipality, land broker K. Sivaraman, and office worker P. Thirumalai Rajan. The main accused, JCP Anandh alias Aandhkumar, remains at large and a lookout circular has been issued for his arrest.

Police allege the accused group created fake documents to sell around 180 plots of land belonging to the temple, situated next to land acquired for a project by Gas Authority of India Limited (GAIL). They are believed to have collected approximately ₹3 crore from 100 individuals intending to purchase the land.

This marks the third arrest of a senior official in Puducherry linked to temple land grabbing schemes within a short period. Last year, Ramesh, former Director of Survey, Settlement and Land Records, and D. Balaji, former Director of Fisheries, were suspended for their involvement in the Kamatchiamman temple land grabbing case and are facing both criminal and disciplinary proceedings. 

The arrest of G. Johnson highlights the ongoing issue of temple land grabbing in Puducherry and underscores the need for a thorough investigation to hold those responsible accountable.

title: PMK to Hold Rallies Against DMK Government
news:
The Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) has announced plans to hold three public rallies in Tamil Nadu, targeting the ruling Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) government. These rallies, scheduled for October 17, 20, and 26, will take place in Chidambaram-Vriddhachalam, Thindivanam, and Salem respectively. 

The PMK alleges that the DMK government has failed to fulfill its election promises, particularly regarding job creation and social justice initiatives. PMK founder S. Ramadoss criticizes the DMK for failing to provide jobs for youth, despite promises of 5.5 lakh new positions. He also accuses the government of neglecting its promise to prioritize local youth in private sector hiring.

Furthermore, the PMK condemns the government's inaction on conducting a caste-based census, a move deemed essential by the party to safeguard reservations for various communities. The PMK also criticizes the DMK's decision to increase electricity tariffs, property tax, water tax, and other fees, citing a disproportionate burden on the poor.

Ramadoss concludes by stating that the DMK government's policies have been detrimental to the people and that it is time for a change in leadership. The rallies are intended to highlight these grievances and galvanize public opinion against the ruling party.

title: Four Dead, Including Two Children, After Fuel Station Explosion in Chechnya
news:
A fuel tank explosion at a gas station in the Chechen capital Grozny on Saturday claimed the lives of four people, including two children, according to the Russian region's emergencies ministry. Five others sustained injuries in the incident, which also resulted in a fire.

Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov, in a Telegram statement, confirmed taking personal control of the situation and vowed to bring those responsible for the blast to justice. He did not elaborate on potential causes or suspects. 

This tragedy follows similar incidents in the neighboring region of Dagestan, where explosions at fuel stations in September 2024 and August 2023 resulted in 13 and 35 fatalities, respectively.

title: Ashram Worker Killed in Dispute Over Mango Leaves
news:
A 29-year-old man, S. Prasanth, was arrested in Tiruvannamalai on Saturday for killing a 70-year-old ashram worker, S. Manickam, in a dispute over mango leaves. 

The incident occurred near the Arunachaleswara temple, where Prasanth worked at the Poondi ashram. Manickam and his wife, M. Lakshmi, had been living at another ashram for 20 years. 

The altercation began when Manickam and his wife were collecting mango leaves from a tree near Prasanth's ashram. Prasanth objected, claiming the leaves were needed for Vijayadashami festival celebrations.  

A scuffle ensued, leaving Manickam with serious head injuries. He was transported to the Government Medical College Hospital, where he later succumbed to his injuries. 

Based on a complaint filed by Lakshmi, police arrested Prasanth from his hideout in the town. A case has been registered and Prasanth is being held at the sub-jail. The investigation is ongoing.

title: Baba Siddique: The Man Who Brought Bollywood's Khans Together
news:
Baba Siddique, a former Maharashtra Minister and leader of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), was tragically shot dead in Mumbai on October 12, 2024. While Siddique held political positions, his true claim to fame lay in his influence on the Bollywood landscape. 

He was instrumental in ending the long-standing feud between superstar actors Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan. The two had a public altercation in 2008 and largely avoided each other in public events thereafter. However, in 2013, Siddique's annual Iftar party became the platform for a reconciliation between the Khans, bringing them back together. 

Siddique's Iftar parties were known for their star-studded guest lists, attracting Bollywood actors, TV personalities, and content creators. They became a significant social event during the month of Ramadan. 

While Siddique's political career saw him serve as an MLA for three consecutive terms and as Minister of State, it was his role in bringing together two of Bollywood's biggest stars that cemented his place in the entertainment industry's memory.

title: Baba Siddique: Former Maharashtra Minister Shot Dead in Mumbai
news:
Baba Siddique, a prominent figure in the Indian National Congress (INC) and former Maharashtra minister, was shot dead in Mumbai on October 12, 2024.  

Siddique, a senior member of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), served as a minister in the previous Maharashtra government. He was known for his close ties to Bollywood celebrities and hosted several high-profile parties. The circumstances surrounding his death are still under investigation.

title: India Stands Alone as 104 Nations Condemn Israel's Ban on UN Secretary General
news:
A letter signed by 104 countries, including European and African nations as well as a significant portion of the Global South, has condemned Israel's ban on UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres.  India, however, did not join the chorus of international disapproval, choosing to remain silent on the matter. 

The letter, circulated by Chile and supported by nations like Brazil, Colombia, South Africa, Uganda, Indonesia, Spain, Guyana, and Mexico, highlights the importance of respecting the UN's leadership and mission. It reinforces the international community's support for Guterres and his work, emphasizing the detrimental impact of Israel's actions on the UN's ability to mediate conflicts and provide humanitarian aid.

India's decision to abstain from signing the letter is particularly noteworthy given its past record of abstaining from resolutions critical of Israel. This decision, however, stands out as a departure from the general consensus, as the letter focuses on defending the UN itself and not on taking sides in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

Israel's ban on Guterres was issued by Foreign Minister Israel Katz, who accused the Secretary General of failing to criticize Iranian missile strikes on Israel unequivocally. This accusation, however, contradicts Guterres' statements on Iran's actions, both before and after the ban. 

The UN Security Council has also publicly expressed support for Guterres, issuing a statement last week criticizing any decision not to engage with the Secretary General as counterproductive, especially in the context of escalating tensions in the Middle East. 

While the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has declined to comment on India's decision, its spokesperson stated on October 4 that India considers Guterres the UN Secretary General and refrains from commenting on the actions of third parties.

title: From Background Dancer to Bollywood Queen: Deepika Padukone's Rise to Success
news:
Deepika Padukone, one of Bollywood's highest-paid actresses, has come a long way from her humble beginnings. Initially a runway model and national-level badminton player, she later appeared in numerous dance videos as a background dancer before making her acting debut. 

Her breakout role came in the 2007 blockbuster "Om Shanti Om," opposite Shah Rukh Khan, solidifying her place in the industry. Since then, she has delivered numerous hits, collaborating with leading stars like Hrithik Roshan and Ranbir Kapoor, and cementing her status as a top-tier actress. 

While her professional life soared, Deepika faced personal challenges, including a high-profile breakup with Ranbir Kapoor and subsequent depression. However, she persevered and achieved a powerful comeback, delivering impactful performances in films like "Chennai Express" and "Padmaavat."

Deepika, now happily married to actor Ranveer Singh and a new mother, is estimated to have a net worth of Rs 500 crore, showcasing her incredible success and undeniable influence in Bollywood.

title: Agra to Receive Two Vande Metro Trains and One Vande Bharat Express
news:
Agra is set to welcome two Vande Metro trains and one Vande Bharat Express, adding to its already expanding railway network. The Vande Metro trains will operate between Agra and New Delhi, and Agra and Lucknow. The Vande Bharat Express, which will operate three days a week, will run between Jodhpur and Agra.

The fare structure, number of coaches, and timetables for all three trains will be announced soon. The Vande Metro trains are expected to replace the existing New Delhi and Lucknow Intercity trains, offering a more comfortable and modern travel experience. 

These trains are expected to operate at a maximum speed of 110 km per hour and can accommodate up to 1150 passengers. The Vande Bharat Express will be the fifth such train in the Agra region, adding to the existing four.

The new additions will provide improved connectivity and contribute to the overall development of Agra, a popular tourist destination.

title: Dasara Celebrations Fill Belagavi and Dharwad with Festivity
news:
Belagavi and Dharwad in Karnataka witnessed vibrant Dasara celebrations on Saturday, showcasing a blend of traditional rituals and cultural performances. 

In Belagavi, the highlight was a colorful procession featuring youth dressed as Asuras, followed by a Seemolanghana ritual at Vidya Niketan grounds. The procession also included palanquins carrying deities like Venkataramana, Maruti, Jyotiba and the Shami tree.  Five chariots of deities, including Marriama Devi, Muthu Mariamma Kunti Devi and Mariama, were also a part of the celebration. 

Dharwad witnessed a grand Jambo Savari, a traditional procession with elephants carrying images of deities. The event began with prayers at the Bandemma Temple in Gandhinagar, followed by the procession featuring elephants carrying the Bandemma Devi idol. Over 35 art troupes showcased various traditional dance forms like Dollu Kunitha, Hejje Mela, Kolata, and Yakshagana, adding to the festive atmosphere.  

Union Minister Pralhad Joshi inaugurated the palanquin procession organized by the Dharwad Dasara Jambo Savari Committee.  The procession traversed through various parts of the city, culminating at Kalabhavan Maidan.

title: Indian MP Calls for Toll Suspension on Incomplete Roads
news:
Jagadish Shettar, a member of India's Lok Sabha (lower house of parliament), has requested the suspension of toll collection on two roads in Karnataka state. 

Shettar, in a letter to Union Minister of Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari, argued that the Belagavi–Khanapur and Belagavi–Sankeshwar–Karud roads are still under construction, with work on widening and repairs ongoing. He stated that residents are facing hardship due to the toll collection on these incomplete roads.

Shettar's request calls for a temporary halt to toll collection until the construction work is finished. The roads are located in the Belagavi district of Karnataka, with Shettar representing the region in the Lok Sabha.

title: Sanju Samson Silences Critics with Maiden T20I Century
news:
Sanju Samson, the star batsman for Team India, silenced his critics in the third and final T20 match against Bangladesh in Hyderabad. He smashed a blistering century in just 40 balls, becoming the second-fastest Indian to reach the milestone in T20 Internationals, behind only Rohit Sharma. 

Samson's innings was a display of explosive batting, particularly against Bangladesh spinner Rishad Hossain, whom he hit for five consecutive sixes in the 10th over. He also reached his half-century in a record-breaking 22 balls. 

This remarkable performance overshadowed his earlier struggles in the series, as he failed to deliver significant scores in the first two matches. The century, his first in T20 Internationals, showcased Samson's immense potential and will surely give him a much-needed confidence boost.

title: India to Provide Fortified Rice Through Public Distribution System
news:
The Indian government will begin distributing fortified rice through its Public Distribution System (PDS), according to Union Minister Pralhad Joshi. This initiative, aimed at combating malnutrition, will cost approximately ₹18,000 crore over the next five years.

The fortified rice will be included in existing schemes like Garib Kalyan (PMGKAY) and Antyodaya Anna Yojana Scheme (AAY), which provide subsidized rice to low-income families.  

The government expects this move to help combat anemia and other health issues among vulnerable populations.

title: Man Arrested for Murdering Father-in-Law in Family Dispute
news:
A 65-year-old man, M. Gnanaguru, was found murdered in Karungalapalli near Kulithalai on Saturday. According to sources, the victim was attacked with a knife by his son-in-law, P. Rajendran, during a family dispute. 

Gnanaguru, a load man, sustained severe injuries and was rushed to the Kulithalai Government Hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries. 

Police in Kulithalai have registered a case and arrested Rajendran. The motive behind the murder remains unclear, but the police are investigating the incident further.

title: Caste Tensions Flare After Assault on BJP MLA in Uttar Pradesh
news:
A recent incident involving the alleged assault of Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Yogesh Verma by Lakhimpur Bar Association President Awadhesh Singh has sparked intense caste-based tensions in Uttar Pradesh. 

The attack, which occurred during preparations for the Urban Cooperative Bank Management Committee elections, has seen social organizations aligning themselves with either the alleged attacker or the victim, with both sides demanding action against the other. 

The Rajput Karni Sena, a caste-centric group, has publicly supported Singh, alleging that Verma has been involved in inappropriate behavior, which they claim is documented on social media. The organization also announced a "Kshatriya Mahapanchayat" to address the situation. 

Meanwhile, several Kurmi caste-centric groups, including the Patel Seva Sansthan and Kurmi Kshatriya Sabha, have rallied behind Verma. These groups have condemned the assault, demanding the arrest of Singh and his wife, as well as the transfer of a local official. They have also threatened to express their discontent through the ballot box if the perpetrators are not punished.

The Congress party has used the incident to criticize the ruling BJP, accusing the government of failing to protect backward leaders and enabling the "goons" of the Chief Minister's caste to attack those from lower communities. 

The incident has highlighted the deep-rooted caste dynamics within Uttar Pradesh and the potential for conflict to arise from such events.  As the situation unfolds, it remains to be seen how authorities will address the demands from both sides and ensure that the incident does not escalate further.

title: AI: A Brave New World - But Can We Handle It?
news:
As artificial intelligence (AI) evolves into artificial general intelligence (AGI), mimicking human cognitive abilities and solving long-standing problems, the need for robust safety protocols becomes paramount. 

This year's Nobel Prizes highlight the rapid progress in AI, with awards recognizing breakthroughs in machine learning and protein structure prediction. Demis Hassabis, the 2024 Nobel laureate in Chemistry,  is at the forefront of AGI research, aiming to solve intelligence and then use it to tackle global challenges like climate change and medical breakthroughs. 

While the potential benefits of AGI are immense, so are the risks. Experts like Stephen Hawking and Geoffrey Hinton warn of the dangers of uncontrolled AI, with Hassabis himself acknowledging the seriousness of the risks. 

As AI evolves, we must navigate ethical dilemmas and prevent the potential misuse of these powerful technologies.  The future holds both tremendous promise and potential peril, and it is imperative that we prioritize the responsible development and deployment of AI to ensure a safe and beneficial future for humanity.

title: 'Neithal' Arts Festival Concludes in Thoothukudi
news:
The third edition of the 'Neithal' arts festival in Thoothukudi, Tamil Nadu, concluded on Sunday. The event, held at the Sankaraperi Pass Grounds, celebrated Tamil culture and traditions with performances by folk artists, showcasing various art forms like 'thappattam.'  

The festival featured over 50 stalls showcasing local products including handmade goods, millets, and organic produce. Visitors also enjoyed popular dishes from different regions.

Speaking at the inauguration, Lok Sabha MP Kanimozhi emphasized the Tamil Nadu government's commitment to preserving and promoting Tamil culture. She highlighted the importance of showcasing these traditions to the younger generation through art. 

NABARD played a significant role in the festival, supporting various stakeholders in bringing their products to the event. The event was presided over by Collector K. Illambahavath, with the participation of other officials including Corporation Commissioner L. Madhubalan, Additional Collector R. Aishwarya, and NABARD General Manager Jothi Srinivasan.

title: Chennai Residents Lift Their Homes to Avoid Floods
news:
In Chennai, a city prone to heavy monsoon flooding, residents are increasingly turning to a novel solution: lifting their houses. This innovative technique is proving to be a lifeline for those living in low-lying areas where floodwaters regularly invade their homes.

Following the devastating floods of 2015 and 2017, the demand for house-lifting services has surged. Companies like R. Yuga Balan's are witnessing a boom in inquiries, particularly from residents near lakes where road levels have risen.

The process typically involves raising the house by using hydraulic jacks and filling the space with sand or gravel. The cost can vary but starts around ₹3 lakh for the first three feet and ₹50,000 for every additional foot.

While this method appears simple and effective, it's not without considerations. Older buildings require structural assessments to ensure safety, and the elevation needs to be carefully calculated to maintain accessibility. However, experts like Benny Raphael, head of the Civil Engineering department at IIT-Madras, assure that the process does not weaken the structure.

The recent lifting of the Sri Utthara Guruvayoorappan Temple in Nanganallur serves as a testament to the effectiveness of this solution. Following years of flooding issues, the temple was raised 5.5 feet and is now prepared to face the monsoon season.

The rising popularity of house-lifting in Chennai highlights the need for proactive flood mitigation strategies. While this innovative technique offers immediate relief, long-term solutions are crucial to address the root causes of flooding and ensure the safety and well-being of residents.

title: Indian President and Prime Minister Celebrate Vijayadashmi
news:
President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the Vijayadashmi celebrations at the Red Fort Ground in Delhi on October 12, 2024. The event featured a performance of the Ramleela, depicting the victory of Lord Rama over Ravana. 

The ceremony included a traditional welcome for the dignitaries, with the organizers presenting the President with a trident and the Prime Minister with a mace.  They were also gifted a bow and arrow symbolizing strength and good governance.  

The festivities culminated in the burning of effigies of Ravana, his son Meghnad, and brother Kumbhakaran, accompanied by cheers from the assembled crowd.

title: Chennai Prepares for Monsoon: 13,000 Volunteers Ready to Assist
news:
With the northeast monsoon expected to begin in Chennai on Monday, the Chennai Corporation is stepping up flood preparedness.  Over 13,000 volunteers, many of whom are college students, have registered to assist flood-affected residents.  

The corporation is also establishing relief centers and community kitchens across the city. Each of the 200 wards will receive at least one center, with vulnerable wards receiving two.  These centers will provide shelter and food to those impacted by flooding.  

The corporation has already surveyed over 11,000 households in vulnerable areas, prioritizing assistance for senior citizens, people with disabilities, pregnant women, and children. 

The corporation is also working on drainage systems, with officials inspecting localities on Saturday to monitor the progress of creating temporary arrangements for draining floodwater.

title: Mysuru Dasara Procession Showcases Karnataka's Cultural Diversity
news:
The grand finale of the 10-day Mysuru Dasara festivities, the Vijayadashami procession, concluded on Saturday with a captivating display of Karnataka's cultural richness.  A massive crowd gathered in the city of palaces to witness the spectacle, braving rain to see the parade unfold along the ‘Raja Marga’. 

The procession featured nearly 49 tableaux and over 100 cultural troupes, showcasing the diverse traditions of almost every district in Karnataka.  The tableaux included representations from 31 districts, as well as from various government departments, institutions, and corporations.

title: 5 Steps to Manage Diabetes Before Bed and Prevent Nighttime Blood Sugar Spikes
news:
Managing diabetes effectively involves controlling blood sugar levels throughout the day, including nighttime. Here are 5 tips to help regulate glucose levels before bedtime:

1. **Choose Wisely: Evening Snacks**

   Avoid sugary snacks and opt for protein-rich or fiber-rich options like nuts, Greek yogurt, or carrot sticks with hummus. These snacks help stabilize blood sugar without causing spikes.

2. **Embrace Consistency: Sleep Schedule**

   Establish a regular sleep schedule by going to bed and waking up at the same time each day. Consistent sleep helps regulate hormones controlling appetite and blood sugar, preventing insulin resistance.  

3. **Turn Off the Screens: Limit Screen Time**

   The blue light emitted from electronic devices can disrupt melatonin production, making sleep difficult. Turn off screens at least 30 minutes before bed and opt for relaxing activities like reading or meditation.

4. **Stay Hydrated, But Not Too Much:**

   While hydration is important, limit fluid intake in the hour before bed. Drinking too much water can lead to nighttime bathroom trips, disrupting sleep.

5. **Monitor Your Blood Sugar: Before Bed**

   Before going to bed, check your blood sugar levels. This helps understand your body's response to food, medication, and daily activities. Adjust your evening meal or insulin dosage if needed, aiming for a blood sugar level within your target range.

By following these strategies, you can significantly improve your nighttime blood sugar control and prevent spikes. Remember to consult a healthcare professional for personalized advice tailored to your specific needs.

title: Chennai Hospital Holds Event to Raise Arthritis Awareness
news:
Soundarapandian Bone and Joint Hospital in Chennai hosted an event on October 12th to mark World Arthritis Day 2024. The event focused on increasing awareness about various forms of arthritis, available treatment options, and advancements in Total Knee Replacement (TKR) surgery. 

The event featured presentations by hospital director S. Sivamurugan, who highlighted the prevalence of arthritis, particularly osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis. He emphasized the importance of maintaining a healthy Body Mass Index (BMI), diet, and exercise to manage arthritis.  

Sivamurugan also discussed recent advancements in TKR, including personalized surgery utilizing 3D planning software and CT scans to precisely align the knee joint.

The event covered other forms of arthritis, including gout, psoriasis, and ankylosing spondylitis, and the benefits of whole-body cryotherapy for rheumatoid arthritis patients. 

Ganesh Sivamurugan, also from the hospital, discussed the structure and function of articular cartilage and the importance of aerobic exercise, especially for individuals between 20 and 40 years old, to relieve joint pressure.

title: Government Rajaji Hospital in Madurai Gets Advanced Vertigo Lab
news:
Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH) in Madurai has taken a significant step forward in healthcare by inaugurating an advanced vertigo lab. The lab features videonystagmography, a cutting-edge technology that measures involuntary eye movements, enabling precise diagnosis and treatment of balance disorders.

The lab's technology will help diagnose conditions like BPPV (Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo), Meniere’s disease, vestibular migraine, and vestibular neuritis. This, in turn, helps doctors avoid prolonged drug use for vertigo by providing an accurate and early diagnosis, leading to more effective treatment.

Vertigo, a sensation of spinning or dizziness, is often caused by problems in the inner ear's vestibular system. This system is responsible for maintaining balance and spatial orientation.

The videonystagmography test tracks eye movements (nystagmus) in response to various stimuli, like head position changes or visual cues. This helps identify abnormalities in the vestibular system, leading to an accurate diagnosis and a tailored treatment plan, which may include physical therapy, medication, or lifestyle modifications.

The test, which takes about 30 to 60 minutes, is currently offered free of charge at GRH, while it costs between ₹ 4000 to ₹ 5000 in private hospitals. The hospital plans to upgrade the testing facility in the future.

title: Salem's Unopened B.Ed. College: A Symbol of Unfulfilled Promises
news:
Despite being inaugurated in 2019, the government-funded B.Ed. college in Konganapuram, Salem district, remains non-functional. This has led to student and political party protests, demanding the college's immediate opening.

The college, built at a cost of ₹5 crore, was meant to address the lack of government B.Ed. options in Salem, forcing students to attend private institutions in nearby towns. While the COVID-19 pandemic delayed the opening initially, the college has not yet received the necessary approval from the National Council for Teacher Education (NCTE). 

The college's infrastructure is currently unused, with buildings overgrown and potentially capable of accommodating 200 students. Both the AIADMK and DMK governments have been criticized for their inaction. The Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) student wing has threatened protests if the college does not open soon.

The Tamil Nadu Teachers Education University (TNTEU) is currently working to obtain the required clearances. The delay highlights the ongoing struggle for access to affordable and quality education in rural areas.

title: Two Injured in Car-Bus Collision near Hasanur, Erode
news:
Two people were injured when a car collided with a private bus on National Highway 948 near Hasanur, Erode, on Saturday. The car, carrying three passengers, was travelling from Tiruppur to Talavadi, while the tourist bus was headed from Mysuru to Coimbatore.

The accident occurred as the car negotiated a bend on the highway, likely due to slippery road conditions caused by recent rain. Anandan, the driver of the car, escaped unharmed, while his wife Ambika and relative Karuppasamy sustained injuries and were admitted to the Government Hospital in Sathyamangalam. 

Hasanur police are investigating the incident, attributing the cause to the slippery road conditions.
